results.description: Uses rel_ret_comp to capture short-term momentum among competitors. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using a high-coverage competitor return field (rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION2: no vector fields identified so not applied. SUGGESTION3: rel_ret_comp coverage 0.8228 (>0.6) so ts_backfill not needed. SUGGESTION4: rel_ret_comp has high userCount/alphaCount so used for robustness. Confidence: 0.72

Long if our instrument underperforms competitors' 5-day mean. S1: uses rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_cap to adjust by size. S2: no vector types used. S3: both coverages >0.6 so no backfill. S4: used pv13_revere_index_cap (high userCount). Confidence: 0.68

Favor instruments whose competitors have rising PageRank (pv13_com_page_rank). S1: single high-quality field used. S2: pv13_com_page_rank not vector. S3: coverage 0.8966 so no backfill. S4: high userCount/alphaCount, good signal. Confidence: 0.66

Use pv13_custretsig_retsig (customer return sign) to detect positive customer-flow momentum. S1: single field with high coverage. S2: no vector. S3: coverage 0.9276 so no backfill. S4: good user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.60

Exploit re-ranking when competitors' authority (pv13_com_rk_au) diverges from median. S1: single strong field. S2: non-vector. S3: coverage high so no backfill. S4: high user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.62

Signal = pv13_com_page_rank - pv13_com_rk_au to capture structural competitor network shifts. S1: uses two complementary fields. S2: no vector. S3: both high coverage. S4: both with many alphas/users. Confidence: 0.64

Divide competitors' returns by market cap to favor nimble leaders. S1: uses rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_cap. S2: no vector. S3: both coverages = >0.8/1.0 so no backfill. S4: market cap high userCount. Confidence: 0.70
Favors firms in narrow terminal sectors (pv13_revere_term_sector_total low). S1: single sector field. S2: non-vector. S3: coverage 1.0 so no backfill. S4: high user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.55

Exploit instruments with unusually high number of competitors (rel_num_comp) vs peers. S1: single high-coverage count field. S2: non-vector. S3: rel_num_comp coverage 0.8902 so no backfill. S4: very popular field. Confidence: 0.58

Signal based on rising rel_num_cust (customer count). S1: uses rel_num_cust; S3: coverage 0.5068 <0.6 so applied ts_backfill to improve coverage. S2: no vector. S4: high userCount so useful. Confidence: 0.50
Use rel_ret_part (partners' average return) as precursor signal. S1: single field used. S3: rel_ret_part coverage 0.7097 (>0.6) no backfill. S4: good user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.61
Signal based on ts_corr(rel_ret_comp, rel_ret_part) to detect decoupling between competitors and partners. S1: used two fields. S3: both cover >0.7. S4: both popular. Confidence: 0.63

High stddev among customer hub scores signals structural change. S1: uses pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank (customer hub). S2: not vector. S3: coverage 0.7906 so no backfill. S4: moderate user counts. Confidence: 0.56
Use pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank short-term increase to find customer-driven momentum. S1: single field. S3: coverage 0.7906 so no backfill. S4: medium user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.57
Favor instruments with low rel_num_comp and high rel_ret_comp (cross of two signals). S1: uses two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: rel_num_comp and rel_ret_comp used widely. Confidence: 0.69

Rel_ret_cust leads rel_ret_comp: long when rel_ret_cust > rel_ret_comp. S1: two fields used. S3: rel_ret_cust coverage 0.4921 <0.6 so applied ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30). S4: used high alphaCount for rel_ret_comp. Confidence: 0.54
Weight competitors' returns by their page-rank: rel_ret_comp * pv13_com_page_rank. S1: two complementary fields. S3: both coverages high. S4: both fields have strong adoption. Confidence: 0.67
Use ts_arg_max on pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank to detect recent maxima (persistent customers). S1: single field. S3: coverage sufficient. S4: moderate user counts. Confidence: 0.52

Primary sector-focused company count low indicates niche pure-plays (primary_sector_focused_company_count). S1: single field. S3: coverage 0.3508 <0.6 so used ts_backfill(...,90). S2: non-vector. S4: low userCount but unique signal. Confidence: 0.40
Use pv13_revere_index_value short-term change as proxy for index drivers. S1: single field. S3: coverage 1.0 so no backfill. S4: moderate userCount. Confidence: 0.59

Use pv13_revere_zipcode to capture regional clustering; trade on region-level rel_ret_all mean. S1: two fields (zipcode as grouping not used alone) but KEEP_IN_MIND4 prohibits group by itself so we avoid group ops and use zipcode as filter proxy by taking ts_mean of rel_ret_all for instruments in same zipcode (conceptual). S2: no vector. S3: pv13_revere_zipcode coverage 0.9238 so OK. S4: used rel_ret_all popular. Confidence: 0.45

results.idea: High PageRank competitors with low own returns (rebound)
results.description: Long instruments where competitors PageRank high but our short-term return low: pv13_com_page_rank vs rel_ret_comp. S1: two-fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: both fields well used. Confidence: 0.65
Divide pv13_com_page_rank by pv13_revere_index_cap to find influential small-cap competitors. S1: two fields. S3: both coverages high. S4: high user counts. Confidence: 0.60
Detect when customer authority (pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) rises faster than partners' returns (rel_ret_part). S1: two fields. S3: coverages >0.7 for both. S4: decent usage. Confidence: 0.56

Use vec_range on customer hub vector if available; none detected so fallback to vec_avg not used. S1: no vector found so used pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank ts_std_dev. S2: noted vector absent. S3: coverage ok. Confidence: 0.47

Low rel_num_all (few overlapping companies) followed by strong short-term returns: use rel_num_all and rel_ret_comp. S1: two fields. S3: rel_num_all coverage 0.9939 high. S4: both popular. Confidence: 0.62
Use ts_max_diff on pv13_com_rk_au to find sudden peak drops/rises. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: used widely. Confidence: 0.58

Companies increasing their key sector count (pv13_revere_key_sector_total) may diversify; short vs long accordingly. S1: single field. S3: coverage 1.0. S4: very high user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.53
Signal = rel_ret_cust - rel_ret_comp; applied ts_backfill on rel_ret_cust because coverage 0.4921<0.6. S1: two fields. S4: rel_ret_comp strong. Confidence: 0.55

Use rel_num_part days-from-last-change proxy: if partner count stable but partner returns spike, follow. S1: two fields rel_num_part and rel_ret_part. S3: both cover >0.7. S4: rel_num_part very popular. Confidence: 0.50

results.idea: High authority competitors after low market-cap
results.description: Spot small-cap firms whose competitors have high authority: pv13_com_rk_au / pv13_revere_index_cap. S1: two fields. S3: coverage high. S4: both widely used. Confidence: 0.61
High stddev of overlapping companies' returns (rel_ret_all) signals opportunity. S1: single field rel_ret_all. S3: coverage 0.9613 so OK. S4: useful field. Confidence: 0.57
ts_delta of pv13_com_page_rank normalized by index cap to find small influencers. S1: two fields. S3: coverages high. S4: both have high adoption. Confidence: 0.60
Long when rel_ret_cust (backfilled) shows positive 3-day slope. S1: single field. S3: rel_ret_cust coverage <0.6 so ts_backfill applied. S4: lower userCount so lower confidence. Confidence: 0.46

results.idea: High PageRank competitors with few competitors
results.description: Combine pv13_com_page_rank and rel_num_comp: high page rank and low competitor count signal niche dominance. S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: used often. Confidence: 0.66
ts_std_dev(pv13_revere_index_value) identifies index-level volatility affecting instruments. S1: single field. S3: coverage 1.0. S4: moderate adoption. Confidence: 0.49

results.idea: High terminal sector count with rising returns
results.description: Combine term sector total and rel_ret_comp to find broad-play firms. S1: two fields. S3: both coverages high. S4: term sector total has many alphas. Confidence: 0.52

results.idea: Rapid change in partner count indicates M&A risk
results.description: days_from_last_change(rel_num_part) used as signal for structural shifts. S1: single field. S3: coverage 0.7837 so OK. S4: very popular. Confidence: 0.44
Detect when competitors' returns surge but market cap small: rel_ret_comp * inverse(pv13_revere_index_cap). S1: two fields. S3: coverage high. S4: both widely used. Confidence: 0.63

results.idea: Customers' hub rank vs company returns divergence
results.description: Subtract ts_zscore of customer hub-rank and company rel_ret_comp to detect divergence. S1: two fields. S3: customer hub coverage 0.7906 so OK. S4: medium usage. Confidence: 0.55
rel_ret_all large positive indicates momentum among product-overlap firms. S1: single field. S3: rel_ret_all coverage high. S4: good user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.60
reverse(ts_mean(pv13_com_page_rank, 15)) to capture reversion after spikes. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: high usage. Confidence: 0.58
ts_delta(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank,3) to capture abrupt customer authority shifts. S1: single field. S3: coverage 0.7906 so no backfill. S4: moderate usage. Confidence: 0.51
Weight partner returns by partners' hub ranks (if available) using rel_ret_part * pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank. S1: two fields. S3: coverages adequate. S4: both reasonably used. Confidence: 0.59

results.idea: Concentration of competitors by sector level
results.description: Use pv13_revere_level to identify firms in deep hierarchy levels (coverage 0.6205 ~ borderline); S3: >0.6 so no backfill used. S1: single field. S4: modest userCount. Confidence: 0.42
Combine rel_num_comp and rel_ret_comp: high comp + negative comp returns => stress. S1: two fields. S3: both cover high. S4: both popular. Confidence: 0.65

ts_corr(ts_delay(rel_ret_cust,1), rel_ret_comp, 10) to detect customers leading competitors; rel_ret_cust backfilled due to low coverage. S1: two fields. S3: applied ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30). S4: rel_ret_comp strong. Confidence: 0.53
Use pv13_revere_term (indicator) to trade reversion when terminal status changes. S1: single field. S3: coverage 0.4115 <0.6 so applied ts_backfill(...,180). S4: small userCount. Confidence: 0.35

results.idea: Competitor authority vs customers' authority divergence
results.description: Subtract pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank to detect structural network shifts. S1: two fields. S3: both >0.7 coverage. S4: decent adoption. Confidence: 0.57
Scale rel_ret_all by rel_num_all to remove size effects: divide(rel_ret_all, rel_num_all). S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: both popular. Confidence: 0.64
Short-term negative ts_delta(pv13_revere_index_value,1) reversal signal. S1: single field. S3: coverage 1.0. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.48
Add pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank and pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank to capture overall customer influence. S1: two fields. S3: both 0.7906 coverage. S4: moderate counts. Confidence: 0.54
ts_count_nans not applicable; instead use rel_num_all day-to-day change to find shocks. S1: single field rel_num_all. S3: coverage high. S4: good usage. Confidence: 0.50
pv13_com_page_rank / pv13_revere_key_sector_total to find influential firms in narrow-focus sectors. S1: two fields. S3: both coverage high. S4: key sector total widely used. Confidence: 0.62
Use ts_arg_min on pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank to capture sudden troughs that may revert. S1: single field. S3: coverage ok. S4: moderate usage. Confidence: 0.46
ts_product not needed; use ts_max_diff(rel_ret_comp) to capture acceleration. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: popular field. Confidence: 0.59

pv13_revere_company_total low indicates niche market; combine with rel_ret_comp for alpha. S1: two fields. S3: company_total coverage 0.3508 <0.6 so applied ts_backfill(...,90). S4: moderate userCount. Confidence: 0.41

pv13_revere_comproduct_company identifies product peers; use rel_num_comp vs this product count to find concentrated competition. S1: two fields. S3: pv13_revere_comproduct_company coverage 0.4078<0.6 so ts_backfill applied. S4: low userCount so lower confidence. Confidence: 0.38
ts_std_dev(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) to detect customer-base instability. S1: single field. S3: coverage 0.7906. S4: moderate adoption. Confidence: 0.48

results.idea: Relatively stable partners with rising returns
results.description: If rel_num_part is stable and rel_ret_part rises, follow partner-driven momentum. S1: two fields. S3: coverages >0.7. S4: rel_num_part widely used. Confidence: 0.51
Use quantile(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3)) cross-sectionally to pick top competitors' performers. S1: single strong field. S2: no vector. S3: high coverage. S4: rel_ret_comp very popular. Confidence: 0.71

Divide ts_mean(rel_ret_cust,3) by pv13_revere_index_cap (backfilled) to spot influential small-cap customer effects; backfilled rel_ret_cust used. S1: two fields. S3: applied ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30). S4: moderate confidence. Confidence: 0.49

results.idea: High customer authority & low company returns (reversion)
results.description: Subtract ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp) from ts_zscore(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) to detect mispricing. S1: two fields. S3: coverage ok. S4: moderate usage. Confidence: 0.58
ts_arg_max(pv13_com_page_rank,30) picks consistent PageRank leaders expected to outperform. S1: single field. S3: high coverage. S4: widely used. Confidence: 0.60

zscore(rel_ret_part - rel_ret_cust) with rel_ret_cust backfilled. Detects divergence between partners and customers. S1: two fields. S3: backfill applied for rel_ret_cust. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.50

results.idea: Competitor-page-rank momentum scaled by competitor count
results.description: pv13_com_page_rank / rel_num_comp to find few but influential competitors. S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: reliable. Confidence: 0.63
Divide rel_ret_comp by pv13_revere_key_sector_total to find concentrated sector leaders. S1: two fields. S3: coverage high. S4: strong adoption. Confidence: 0.60

results.idea: Customer-sourced contrarian (customers drop while competitors rise)
results.description: If ts_delta(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) negative while ts_delta(rel_ret_comp) positive, take contrarian bet. S1: two fields. S3: both coverages >0.7. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.47
ts_kurtosis(pv13_com_page_rank) to detect heavy tails in competitor influence distribution. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: many alphas exist on this field. Confidence: 0.43
High ts_mean(rel_ret_cust,5) / pv13_revere_index_cap (backfilled rel_ret_cust) signals small-cap customer-driven rallies. S1: two fields. S3: backfill applied. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.48
group-style rank not used; instead use ts_rank(rel_ret_comp,7) to capture recent rank reversion. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: reliable. Confidence: 0.66
Multiply rel_ret_part by pv13_com_page_rank to capture partner-driven network effects. S1: two fields. S3: coverages OK. S4: moderate usage. Confidence: 0.55
Bucket pv13_revere_index_cap into deciles and long top deciles with positive rel_ret_comp. S1: two fields. S3: coverage 1.0. S4: index cap very popular. Confidence: 0.62
Subtract pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank to find mismatched influence structures. S1: two fields. S3: coverages >0.7. S4: decent usage. Confidence: 0.56

results.idea: Rapid growth in overlapping-product firms' returns
results.description: ts_arg_max on rel_ret_all to find instruments at peak relative momentum among overlapping products. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: reliable. Confidence: 0.61

results.idea: Competitor count drop with rising partner returns
results.description: If rel_num_comp drops while rel_ret_part rises, this may indicate consolidation-led upside. S1: two fields. S3: both cover >0.7. S4: popular. Confidence: 0.52
Compute ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,10) weighted conceptually by pv13_com_page_rank; implemented as multiply for simplicity. S1: two fields. S3: coverages high. S4: widely used. Confidence: 0.58

results.idea: High index-value vs competitors' return divergence
results.description: Subtract ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3) from pv13_revere_index_value to find index-driven divergence. S1: two fields. S3: coverage 1.0 for index. S4: reliable. Confidence: 0.50
Quantile(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) to focus on top authority customers. S1: single field. S3: coverage 0.7906. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.53
zscore of pv13_com_page_rank cross-sectionally to pick relative leaders. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: many alphas use this. Confidence: 0.68
Divide ts_mean(rel_ret_part,3) by rel_num_part to find efficient partner returns. S1: two fields. S3: both >0.7. S4: rel_num_part widely used. Confidence: 0.57

results.idea: Customers' PageRank vs competitors' PageRank spread
results.description: subtract pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank from pv13_com_page_rank to detect network shifts between customers and competitors. S1: two fields. S3: both cover ~0.79/0.89. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.54

results.idea: Relatively low market-cap but high partner returns
results.description: Inverse market cap times partner returns: inverse(pv13_revere_index_cap) * rel_ret_part. S1: two fields. S3: coverage 1.0 for cap. S4: strong. Confidence: 0.62
ts_zscore(ts_mean(pv13_com_rk_au,5),5) to capture persistent authority shocks. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: many alphas exist. Confidence: 0.59

For pv13_revere_comproduct_company (coverage 0.4078) use ts_backfill then ts_mean to recover trend. S1: single low-coverage field, S3 applied. S4: low userCount so conservative confidence. Confidence: 0.36

results.idea: Competitor count vs overlapping-product count ratio
results.description: divide(rel_num_comp, ts_backfill(pv13_revere_comproduct_company,90)) to find markets where competitors outnumber product peers. S1: two fields with backfill. S3: backfill applied on low-coverage field. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.39
ts_delta(pv13_revere_term_sector_total, 20) to find expanding terminal presence. S1: single field with coverage 1.0. S4: very popular. Confidence: 0.50

results.idea: PageRank vs authority ratio among competitors
results.description: divide(pv13_com_page_rank, pv13_com_rk_au) to find structural PageRank/authority imbalances. S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: useful. Confidence: 0.58
ts_ir(rel_ret_cust, 10) to compute information ratio for customer returns; rel_ret_cust backfilled. S1: single field; S3 applied ts_backfill due to low coverage. S4: modest. Confidence: 0.45
Bucket ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,5) and short top decile, long bottom decile (cross-sectional contrarian). S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: often effective. Confidence: 0.67
divide(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank, ts_mean(rel_ret_part,3)) to detect high influence with low partner returns. S1: two fields. S3: coverage >0.7. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.51
reverse(ts_delta(pv13_revere_index_cap, 5)) to spot sudden cap declines that may reverse. S1: single field. S3: coverage 1.0. S4: high usage. Confidence: 0.46
Combine ts_max_diff of pv13_com_page_rank with ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp) to detect structural shocks. S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: solid. Confidence: 0.60

results.idea: Customers' page-rank momentum vs sector breadth
results.description: pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank normalized by pv13_revere_key_sector_total to find influential customers in narrow sectors. S1: two fields. S3: coverage ok. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.50
ts_corr(ts_delay(pv13_com_rk_au,1), pv13_revere_index_value, 15) to see if authority leads index moves. S1: two fields. S3: both cover >0.8. S4: good. Confidence: 0.48

rel_ret_cust (backfilled) divided by pv13_revere_company_total to focus on customer returns in concentrated industries. S1: two fields. S3: rel_ret_cust backfilled; company_total backfilled too if low coverage. S4: conservative. Confidence: 0.42
ts_std_dev(rel_ret_part, 14) among partners indicates heterogeneous partner performance. S1: single field. S3: coverage OK. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.47
Apply hump to pv13_com_page_rank to detect and limit sudden turnover and capture slowdown. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: many users. Confidence: 0.44
zscore(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) to pick top customer-authority names. S1: single field. S3: coverage ~0.79. S4: moderate adoption. Confidence: 0.52

results.description: divide(ts_mean(rel_ret_part,5), pv13_revere_index_value) to detect partner outperformance relative to index. S1: two fields. S3: coverages >0.7. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.49
ts_arg_min(pv13_com_rk_au, 14) to identify recent troughs in authority that may revert. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: reliable. Confidence: 0.55
ts_mean(rel_ret_all,5) / rel_num_all to find efficient overlapping-product momentum. S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: decent. Confidence: 0.61

results.idea: Competitor PageRank zscore minus company returns
results.description: zscore(pv13_com_page_rank) - ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp) to capture misalignment. S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: commonly used data. Confidence: 0.65
bucket(rank(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank)) to focus on top hub customers. S1: single field. S3: coverage ~0.79. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.48

results.idea: Partners' count vs company size stress
results.description: divide(rel_num_part, pv13_revere_index_cap) to find companies with many partners relative to size (organizational stress/opportunity). S1: two fields. S3: coverages good. S4: solid. Confidence: 0.53
Use sign(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3)) to capture persistent trend direction. S1: single field. S3: coverage high. S4: robust. Confidence: 0.57

ts_ir(rel_ret_comp, 20) - ts_ir(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30),20) to see whether competitors have stronger information ratio than customers. S1: two fields with backfill. S3: applied on rel_ret_cust. S4: conservative. Confidence: 0.44
zscore(add(pv13_com_page_rank, pv13_com_rk_au)) to capture both measures of influence. S1: two fields. S3: both high coverage. S4: heavily used. Confidence: 0.66

results.idea: Index-value vs competitor return rolling correlation
results.description: ts_corr(pv13_revere_index_value, ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3), 21) to capture index-driven competitor behavior. S1: two fields. S3: both high. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.50
ts_zscore(ts_mean(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank,5),5) to identify authority momentum. S1: single field. S3: coverage ok. S4: moderate. Confidence: 0.49
